thread.title: Grading every 2017 NBA trade deadline deal, from DeMarcus Cousins to P.J. Tucker
thread.title_full: Grading every 2017 NBA trade deadline deal, from DeMarcus Cousins to P.J. Tucker

title: Grading every 2017 NBA trade deadline deal, from DeMarcus Cousins to P.J. Tucker
text:
Feb 23, 2017 at 3:46p ET 0Shares 
The NBA trade deadline came and went Thursday without any earth-shattering, Paul George or Jimmy Butler-based deals, but there was still plenty of action right up until the 3 p.m. ET cut-off point. 
And of course, there was that blockbuster deal last weekend, which we're including in our discussion of every move made ahead of the 2017 NBA trade deadline. Here's every major transaction and our grades for both sides. Sacramento Kings send DeMarcus Cousins and Omri Casspi to the New Orleans Pelicans for Buddy Hield, Langston Galloway, Tyreke Evans, a top-3 protected 2017 first-round pick and a 2017 second-round pick 
Kings grade: F 
Who would have thought that believing Buddy Hield is the second coming of Stephen Curry would lead a team to make one of the most lopsided trades in NBA history? 
Pelicans grade: A+ 
Two weeks ago, the Pelicans were staring down the barrel of perpetual mediocrity and in serious danger of losing Anthony Davis. Now, New Orleans has the makings of a potential superteam that could threaten the Warriors â€” if everything goes right for Alvin Gentry's squad, anyway. 
Source: Official release Chuck Cook Chuck Cook-USA TODAY Sports Los Angeles Lakers send Lou Williams to the Houston Rockets for Corey Brewer and a future first-round pick 
Lakers grade: B- 
Source: NBA.com Philadelphia 76ers send Ersan Ilyasova to the Atlanta Hawks for Tiago Splitter and a 2017 second-round pick 
76ers grade: B+ 
Source: Yahoo.com Brooklyn Nets send Bojan Bogdanovic and Chris McCullough to the Washington Wizards for Marcus Thornton, Andrew Nicholson and a lottery-protected 2017 first-round pick 
Nets grade: B+ 
Source: Yahoo.com Bill Streicher-USA TODAY Sports Bill Streicher Philadelphia 76ers send Nerlens Noel to the Dallas Mavericks for Andrew Bogut, Justin Anderson, and a top-18-protected first-round pick 
76ers grade: D-
